messageBody:
Hi guys,

I wrote an open source extension module for JUnit 3 to test TIBCO
Rendezvous (a messaging middleware) and I'm trying to port it to JUnit 4
using the annotations.

My basic requirement is that a method is called before and another after
the execution of any given test method.

For example:

@TibPrepare(service = "7500")
@Test
public void tibPrepare() {
...
}

Where TibPrepare is my annotation. So my question is how do I tell jUnit
4 to invoke such and such a class/method?

My initial thought was to extend TestDecorator however my issue is that
I want this extension of jUnit to work everywhere, including in IDEs
such as Intellij IDEA (the one I'm using, just an example).

If I take IntelliJ, they appear to be using junit.textui.TestRunner and
have defined their own callbacks (for example:
com.intellij.rt.junit4.Junit4TestMethodAdapter.run is called by
junit.framework.TestSuite.runTest)

So I'm a bit stumped here on how to best implement a jUnit 4 extension
that is always invoked whatever the environment (maven, ant, IDE such as
IntelliJ or Eclipse).

Any help would be appreciated, and I apologize in advance if the
question has already been raised before, but I haven't found such a
Topic in this list.

Regards,

Cedric.
